alerts.headline: snowfall warning ended
alerts.description:
Significant snowfall is no longer expected.


###

alerts.headline: snowfall warning ended
alerts.description:
Significant snowfall is no longer expected.


###

alerts.headline: snowfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Snowfall with total amounts of about 15 cm is expected.

What:
Snowfall amounts near 15 cm.
Peak snowfall rates of 2 to 5 cm per hour.
Risk of freezing rain for some areas.
Reduced visibility in snow and local blowing snow.

When:
Continuing into late this evening.

Additional information:
Snow has tapered over Timmins and Gogama, but may continue to near midnight for locations toward the Ontario-Quebec border. Northwesterly winds gusting to 50 km/h may result in local blowing snow.

###

Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop. Take frequent breaks and avoid strain when clearing snow.

alerts.headline: snowfall warning ended
alerts.description:
Significant snowfall is no longer expected.


###

alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect for today.

What: 
Total snowfall amounts of 10 cm. Local accumulations may approach 15 cm. 
Peak snowfall rates of 4 cm per hour. 
Poor visibility in heavy snow. 

When: 
Ending this afternoon near Lake of the Woods and this evening for areas near Lake Superior. 

Additional information: 
A band of heavy snow has developed and is affecting areas along and north of the international border.

###

Motorists should expect hazardous winter driving conditions and adjust travel plans accordingly.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Be prepared to adjust your driving with changing road conditions. Take extra care when walking or driving in affected areas. If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.

affected_areas.area_description: Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake
